stories.title: What does a black hole sound like? NASA has an answer

stories.text:
I know this might be a weird question to submit, but this is something that has been bothering me for a while.

After working sometime on a complex sequences of actions to solve a particular problem, I found a library that basically did what I was trying to do, in a more concrete way and with edge cases that I had not considered

So I started thinking that this is not the first time something like this has happened to me, so I ask, is there any kind of tool that, after analyzing your code could give you a recommendation of a library that is similar enough that it could help in your particular problem? Or if not how difficult it could be to make one?

I feel like it's almost impossible because it needs to analyze the "intention" behind the code and not necessarily the code itself, but I wanted to ask if anyone has the knowledge about something similar
stories.title: Extension/Library for Finding Libraries?

stories.text:
Hi HN,

Recently, Stripe open-sourced markdoc and I started using it. Since there was no syntax highlighting available for it, I created one for VSCode. I hope this helps others like me.

https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=mohitsin...
